meanings.sent1: She ran prolately towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The rocket soared prolately into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched prolately after waking up from a nap.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches reached prolately towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved prolately across the stage, gracefully extending her arms.

meanings.definition: To extend or lengthen in a prolate manner
meanings.sent1: He tried to prolately stretch the rubber band around the box.
meanings.sent2: The snake began to prolately slither through the grass.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to prolately roll out the dough for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The construction workers had to prolately extend the bridge to reach the other side.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully prolately shaped the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
